name: tumid
content:

(of a part of the body) swollen, and larger in size than normal: He had coarse features, a blunt nose, and tumid and protruded lips.
More examplesFewer examplesBig heads, tumid abdomens, flaccid skins, bulged joints, and pinched chests are all signs of malnourishment in infants.It is said that a gentlewoman having a swelled tumid hand, put her finger into a cat's ear, and within two hours was delivered of her pain.He noted the children's "puffy, tumid flesh".In the advertisement, she holds two large light-bulbs in one hand, their tumid shapes gently echoing the swell of her breasts.
